title: Level 7 Human Resource Management (120 Credits)
subheading: Enrol today for £20 and spread the cost over 24 months interest free.
study_pace: Flexible, up to 5 years to complete
ofqual_link: Level 7 Diploma in Human Resource Management – 603/0722/5
description: This Level 7 Diploma in Human Resource Management is an MBA advanced entry course providing 120 credits out of 180 required for a full MBA. The course consists of 6 interactive modules and 6 written assignments, with 40 guided learning hours per module.Each module also includes an additional 30 to 50 learning hours of optional materials, which comprise recommended exercises, readings, internet resources, and self-testing exercises. You will also have access to 24/7 support, tutoring, and a variety of other support mechanisms.fter receiving your Level 7 diploma, you are eligible to apply for an MBA top-up course, either online or on campus at a range of UK universities. The top-up portion will usually consist of the final 60 credits of either a dissertation or a dissertation and one module.

section.title: How It Works
content: Students on our Human Resource Management course can complete Level 7 diploma, designed to provide students with the skills needed to succeed in the Human Resource Management industry.

The course is completed online and you can start at any time, it’s completely flexible. Each module consists of 40 hours of guided online learning, with an additional 30-50 hours worth of optional materials that include recommended exercises, readings, digital resources and self-test tasks.

To complete the course you’ll submit 6 online assignments at Level 7. Assignments are approximately 2,000-3,000 words each. Once you’ve passed your course, you’ll be awarded with a Qualifi Level 7 diploma and you’ll be able to top up your qualification to an MBA at a range of UK universities.

During this Human Resource Management course you’ll have access to 1-2-1 tutor support and webinars, social learning forums and additional materials to complete your diploma with ease. You can also read about the academic credentials we meet and associations we’re part of to make sure you have the best learning experience.

section.title: Course Modules
section.heading: Course Modules
modules1: This Human Resource Management course contains 6 online modules. These are designed by Online Business School’s expert academic team to provide students with a solid theoretical basis for developing their teaching skills, and therefore cover the following topics:

sublists: Investigating a business issue from an HR perspective

sublists: Investigating a business issue from an HR perspective

section.title: Entry Requirements
section.heading: Am I eligible for this programme?
content: To enrol on this Level 7 programme, you must be 21+ years old.
Learners will be expected to hold a level 6 qualification or a first degree. In certain circumstances, managers with considerable experience but no formal qualifications may be considered
To find out more, talk to one of our helpful team members at: 0333 772 1158

section.title: Career Progression
section.heading: Progression Routes
modules1: On completion of this course, students have the opportunity to complete an MBA programme from a range of UK universities. The top-up programme can be studied online or on campus. The MBA top-up comprises the final 60 credits, which consists of either a dissertation or a dissertation and one module.
Students can apply to any university offering the MBA/MSc top-up and can choose to study for their degree either online or in-person on campus.
If you decide to top up to a full MBA/MSc through an accredited UK university, some costs are listed below.
modules2: Upon completing this Level 7 course, learners can join a university partner to complete a dissertation to then receive a full master’s degree. Learners can also step directly into employment in an associated profession.

title: Level 7 Strategic Management and Leadership
subheading: Enrol today for £20 and spread the cost over 24 months interest-free.
study_pace: Flexible, up to 5 years to complete
ofqual_link: Level 7 Diploma in Strategic Management and Leadership – 601/5335/0
description: The Level 7 Diploma in Strategic Management and Leadership is an MBA advanced entry course providing 120 credits out of 180 required for a full MBA. The course consists of 30 interactive modules and 8 written assignments, with 40 guided learning hours per module.

section.title: How It Works
content: Students on our Strategic Management and Leadership course can complete Level 7 diploma, designed to provide students with the skills needed to succeed in the Strategic Management and Leadership industry.

The course is completed online and you can start at any time, it’s completely flexible. Each module consists of 40 hours of guided online learning, with an additional 30-50 hours worth of optional materials that include recommended exercises, readings, digital resources and self-test tasks.

To complete the course you’ll submit 8 online assignments at Level 7. Assignments are approximately 2,000-3,000 words each. Once you’ve passed your course, you’ll be awarded with a Qualifi Level 7 diploma and you’ll be able to top up your qualification to an MBA at a range of UK universities.

During this Strategic Management and Leadership course you’ll have access to 1-2-1 tutor support and webinars, social learning forums and additional materials to complete your diploma with ease. You can also read about the academic credentials we meet and associations we’re part of to make sure you have the best learning experience.

section.title: Module Descriptions
section.heading: Module Descriptions
modules1: The Level 7 Diploma in Strategic Management and Leadership course covers a wide range of essential leadership, management, and strategic topics. The following modules provide learners with the necessary skills and knowledge to thrive in high-level management roles.

sublists.name: Qualities of effective leadership
sublists.description: Learners will explore the making and developing of powerful leaders.

sublists.name: Developing interpersonal skills
sublists.description: Connecting and bonding with people within the commercial sectors is extremely important for good business. This module trains learners in skills to improve and enhance communication techniques to create strong bonds.

sublists.name: Motivating and influencing people
sublists.description: Inspiring people to create a unity of direction within business.

sublists.name: Making decisions
sublists.description: Doing the right things in the right way at the right time. Learners will look at the process of making a good decision.

sublists.name: Creativity and problem solving
sublists.description: Do problems pose a threat or are they an opportunity to improve? Here, learners will figure out how to turn a problem into an advantage.

sublists.name: Studying and using management theories
sublists.description: There are many theories concerned with management and the various models developed from these theories. This module looks over these theories with real life examples.

sublists.name: The external operating environment of business
sublists.description: Planning for influences on the business outside your control.

sublists.name: Culture and ethics
sublists.description: The culture and ethics involved in the business world today.

sublists.name: Governance and directorships
sublists.description: Structuring and controlling a business the professional way.

sublists.name: Analysing the competition
sublists.description: What are my competitors doing, how are they doing it, why are they doing it? Reviewing and analysing competitor actions to enhance managerial roles.

sublists.name: Marketing strategy
sublists.description: Creating an effective and successful market presence. Looking at the development of marketing strategies to create successful marketing campaigns.

sublists.name: High performance sales
sublists.description: Learners will grasp the key elements of successful selling.

sublists.name: E-Marketing communication
sublists.description: Understanding and using effective electronic messages to market.

sublists.name: Customers and their needs
sublists.description: Ensuring that your customers are recognised and valued.

sublists.name: Strategic human resource management
sublists.description: Human Resource Management must play a central role in the strategy of any organization. It is concerned with people as an asset of the business.

sublists.name: Recruiting and CPD
sublists.description: Getting the best people. Developing the best people. Keeping the best people.

sublists.name: Measuring and rewarding performance
sublists.description: Knowing and measuring how your people are performing.

sublists.name: Interpreting business accounts
sublists.description: Using and understanding the litmus tests of business health.

sublists.name: Tools of financial analysis
sublists.description: Resources, tools and techniques to keep a finger on the pulse of the business.

sublists.name: Managing cash and working capital
sublists.description: Cash, cash flow and working capital. The lifeblood of business.

sublists.name: Exercises in quantitative techniques
sublists.description: How to use and understand key figures.

sublists.name: Impact of technology on business
sublists.description: Analyse and exploit the role of e-business within a business sector.

sublists.name: Innovation and R&D
sublists.description: Creating commercial advantage from innovation and research.

sublists.name: Implementing and managing quality systems
sublists.description: Right first time, right every time. The place of quality in business strategy.

sublists.name: Strategic planning tools
sublists.description: Resources, tools and ideas to help create an effective business strategy.

sublists.name: Strategic and systems management
sublists.description: Options for strategic direction. Making the right choices for your business.

sublists.name: The business plan
sublists.description: Creating a plan that targets the stated aims and objectives of a business.

sublists.name: Developing high performance teams
sublists.description: Cohesion and teamwork that enhances business performance.

sublists.name: Managing projects
sublists.description: Getting things done. Using the right tools to run projects.

sublists.name: Strategies for growth
sublists.description: This module explores the different ideas of growth and the various tools, measures and controls at a manager’s disposal in planning for growth.

modules2: The assignment unit titles for the Level 7 course are:

sublists: Manage Team Performance to Support Strategy
Information Management and Strategic Decision Taking

modules3: For more details, visit the official course page:

section.title: Career Progression
content: On completion of this course, students have the opportunity to complete an MBA programme from a range of UK universities. The top-up programme can be studied online or on campus. The MBA top-up comprises the final 60 credits which consists of either a dissertation or a dissertation and one module.

Upon successful completion of the postgraduate diploma in strategic management and leadership and the final year of an accredited postgraduate degree programme, learners will have the skills to execute a professional managerial role in marketing, accounting, business consultancy, and more.

A business management diploma and MBA develops key cognitive skills such as critical thinking, analysis, evaluation, and writing while also establishing presentation and numeracy skills to enhance knowledge and experience. These skills are critical in helping you advance your career.

section.title: University Options
content: On completion of this course students have the opportunity to complete an MBA programme from a range of UK universities. The top up programme can be studied online or on campus. The MBA top up comprises the final 60 credits which consists of either a dissertation or a dissertation and one module.
Students may top-up on campus or by distance learning.
Students can apply to any university offering the MBA top up, the following universities run Top Up programmes by distance and on campus learning:

section.title: Career Progression
content: Upon Successful completion of the Psychology Level 7 course, graduates can pursue diverse career paths. Options include becoming a clinical psychologist, offering therapeutic support for mental health issues, or specialising in counselling psychology in educational or community settings. Careers in forensic psychology, health psychology, and industrial-organisational psychology are also viable, with opportunities in legal assessments, healthcare, and organisational development.

Graduates can opt for research and academic roles, contributing to studies and teaching at universities. Other avenues include roles in non-profit organisations, human resources, or becoming life coaches, utilising their psychological expertise to assist individuals in various aspects of personal and professional development. Gaining practical experience and considering specialisation through certifications further enhances career prospects in these fields.

Job prospects include roles as project managers, where individuals can demonstrate their ability to analyse risks, manage resources efficiently, and communicate effectively with stakeholders. The diploma also enhances the potential for career advancement, paving the way for executive and strategic roles within the project management field. Overall, this qualification sets the stage for a fulfilling and successful career in project management.

The course is completed online and you can start at any time, it’s completely flexible. Each module consists of 40 hours of guided online learning, with an additional 30-50 hours worth of optional materials that include recommended exercises, readings, digital resources and self-test tasks.

To complete the course you’ll submit 6 online assignments at Level 7. Assignments are approximately 2,000-3,000 words each. Once you’ve passed your course, you’ll be awarded with a Qualifi Level 7 diploma and you’ll be able to top up your qualification to an MBA at a range of UK universities.

section.title: Module Descriptions
section.heading: Module Descriptions
modules1: The Level 7 Project Management course contains 6 online modules, designed to provide learners with the knowledge and skills needed for effective leadership, project management, and operations within complex project environments.

sublists.name: Leadership and professional development
sublists.description: Focuses on developing personal leadership through self-reflection and tailored exercises, allowing learners to evaluate their styles, approaches, and leadership journey.

sublists.name: Planning, controlling and leading a project
sublists.description: Equips learners with skills to manage and lead projects within international settings, emphasizing the complexity and dynamic nature of project environments, teamwork, and critical management techniques.

sublists.name: Operations and information management for project managers
sublists.description: Covers the dual role of operations and information systems in project success, highlighting process optimization, data-driven decision-making, risk mitigation, and streamlined communication.

sublists.name: Principles of project management
sublists.description: Instils foundational concepts including the project lifecycle, planning, execution, stakeholder management, risk, time and cost control, and reflective practices.

sublists.name: Operations and global supply chain management
sublists.description: Explores how efficient operations and supply chain strategies contribute to business performance, integrating technology, human resources, and process improvement for competitive advantage.

sublists.name: Managing risk, uncertainty and complexity in projects
sublists.description: Delivers advanced skills in managing risk, uncertainty, and complexity, incorporating theoretical models and practical tools for project control across various scales and scopes.

modules2: The assignment unit titles for the Level 7 course are:

sublists: Planning, controlling and leading a project
Operations and information management for project managers
Operations and global supply chain management
Managing risk, uncertainty and complexity in projects
